remarks: The zero function is the only function that sums two zero in a direct product.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.)  Obsolete version of ~ dprdfid as of 14-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
eldprdiOLD.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
eldprdiOLD.w $e |- W = { h e. X_ i e. I ( S ` i ) | ( `' h " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin } $.
eldprdiOLD.1 $e |- ( ph -> G dom DProd S ) $.
eldprdiOLD.2 $e |- ( ph -> dom S = I ) $.
dprdfidOLD.3 $e |- ( ph -> X e. I ) $.
dprdfidOLD.4 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( S ` X ) ) $.
dprdfidOLD.f $e |- F = ( n e. I |-> if ( n = X , A , .0. ) ) $.
dprdfidOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. W /\ ( G gsum F ) = A ) ) $.
$d .0. h n $.
$d A h n $.
$d F h $.
$d G h i n $.
$d I h i n $.
$d S h i n $.
$d X h n $.
$d n ph $.
